item.description:
The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum does a "Third Thursday" evening event each month.

*** It actually starts at 5.30pm but your hostess can only get there @ 7.30pm this time ***



This month's event is "Renaissance Visions"

The Renaissance wasn’t just a flourishing period of culture and ideas – it was, and still is, a mind set. No one more exemplifies this than Gardner – inspired by art, music, gardens, travel, and the world around her, she was the ultimate Renaissance Woman.


The evening includes:
Courtyard Sounds:
Enjoy music by up-and-coming musicians from the New England Conservatory (5:30-8:30pm)
Gallery Travels:
Explore the galleries with a self-guided tour of Renaissance highlights in the collection.
Viewfinder:
Visit the Dutch Room and get acquainted with some of the personalities at home here. And discover the art of marriage with Viewfinder talks throughout the evening in the Triumph of Marriage special exhibition gallery.
Sketching in the Galleries:
Create your own masterpieces with drawing in the cloisters and galleries (6 to 9PM)
Artful Flavors:
Indulge in the culinary arts, signature cocktails including the all-new Madame Gautreau, and more at the courtside bar and Gardner Café.

For more info and to buy tickets, go to Gardner After Hours - January 2009
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the entrance @ 7.30pm or inside the Museum thereafter
item.name: Isabella Stewart Gardner "After Hours" Evening
